titleStmt.title: The pennilesse parliament of threed-bare poets or, The merry fortune-teller, wherein all persons of the four severall complexions may finde their fortunes. Composed by Doctor Merry-man: not onely to purge melancholy: but also to procure tittering and laughing. Full of witty mirth, and delightfull recreation, for the content of the reader.
titleStmt.author: Doctor Merry-man.

titleStmt.title: The pennilesse parliament of threed-bare poets or, The merry fortune-teller, wherein all persons of the four severall complexions may finde their fortunes. Composed by Doctor Merry-man: not onely to purge melancholy: but also to procure tittering and laughing. Full of witty mirth, and delightfull recreation, for the content of the reader.
titleStmt.author: Doctor Merry-man.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Wright, at the Kings Head in the Old Bayley,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
